intro: Osbeckia elliotii, commonly known as Elliot's willow-herb, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the family Montiaceae and typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant has erect, branching stems that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, white to pale pink flowers are arranged in dense clusters, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Osbeckia elliotii is adapted to drought conditions and is often found in rocky soils and along dry streambeds.
